alert.note: Alert for Starr (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 1:01PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Starr and southeastern Zapata Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 101 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 25 miles southwest of Fronton to Los Garzas to 9 miles northeast of Las Lomas. Movement was southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rio Grande City, Roma, Escobares, El Sauz, Viboras, Garciasville, La Rosita, Los Alvarez, Fort Ringgold County Park and Garceno. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for Deep South Texas.
